bill_title: to allow a first class municipality to assess property outside of the municipality's territorial limits with the consent of the county.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow a first class municipality to assess property outside of the municipality's territorial limits with the consent of the county. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-43-5 be amended to read as follows: 9-43-5. Every Any municipality shall have power to may make assessments for local improvements on property adjoining or benefited thereby by the assessments , to collect the same assessments in the manner provided by law, and to fix, determine, and collect penalties for nonpayment of any special assessments. A first class municipality may make assessments outside the municipality's territorial limits if the municipality approves a resolution of necessity and the county in which the property lies approves the municipality's resolution of necessity. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.016 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow a first class municipality to assess property outside of the municipality's territorial limits with the consent of the county. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That § 9-43-5 be amended to read as follows: 9-43-5. Every Any municipality shall have power to may make assessments for local improvements on property adjoining or benefited thereby by the assessments , to collect the same assessments in the manner provided by law, and to fix, determine, and collect penalties for nonpayment of any special assessments. A first class municipality may make assessments outside the municipality's territorial limits if the municipality approves a resolution of necessity and the board of county commissioners in which the property lies approves the municipality's resolution of necessity.
